Question
========

Two independent samples were drawn from two populations with as results:

* Sample 1: size = 16, mean = 42.0, standard deviation = 5.4
* Sample 2: size = 12, mean = 37.0, standard deviation = 5.9

The two-sided 95% confidence interval for $\mu_1$, the average of the first population, is equal to:

Answerlist
----------

* [30.49, 53.51]
* [33.25, 40.75]
* [39.12, 44.88]
* [39.63, 44.37] 

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* [30.49, 53.51]: Incorrect
* [33.25, 40.75]: Incorrect
* [39.12, 44.88]: Correct
* [39.63, 44.37]: Incorrect
